errors.msg: Request currently has an active claim that is not expired yet
errors.name: ActiveClaimNotExpired

errors.msg: Bond must be greater than zero
errors.name: ZeroBondNotAllowed

docs: Solver that claims and pays the bond
accounts.name: solver

docs: Global config
accounts.name: config

docs: BridgeRequest (Variant B: seeds include external owner)
accounts.name: request_pda

docs: Only for seeds (Variant B)
accounts.name: request_owner

docs: Vault (System-owned PDA) that holds the bond
accounts.name: bond_vault

docs: Relayer (authorized) and payer of rent/ATAs
accounts.name: relayer

docs: Token mint (USDC/USDT)
accounts.name: mint

docs: Escrow that holds the locked tokens (owner = signing PDA)
accounts.name: escrow_token

docs: Recipient's ATA (created if it doesn't exist)
accounts.name: recipient_token

docs: Public recipient
accounts.name: recipient

docs: Global config (used to authorize the relayer)
accounts.name: config

docs: Authorized relayer (must be the owner in the config)
accounts.name: relayer

docs: Global config (only to authorize the relayer)
accounts.name: config

docs: WSOL escrow (mint = NATIVE_MINT) owned by the signing PDA
accounts.name: escrow_wsol

docs: Recipient's WSOL account (can be their ATA or any WSOL TokenAccount)
accounts.name: recipient_wsol

docs: Recipient's public wallet (owner of `recipient_wsol`)
accounts.name: recipient

docs: Account that receives the rent if the escrow is closed
accounts.name: escrow_refund_destination

docs: Signing PDA used by Arcium (contains the bump)
accounts.name: sign_pda_account

docs: Anyone can call this; we don't charge rent or create accounts here.
accounts.name: caller

docs: Global config (contains slash_bps, owner as slash collector, etc.)
accounts.name: config

docs: BridgeRequest PDA (Variant B: seeds include external `request_owner`)
accounts.name: request_pda

docs: Only used for seeds; in Variant A you wouldn't pass this.
accounts.name: request_owner

docs: PDA that currently holds the solver's bond in lamports.
accounts.name: bond_vault

docs: We transfer the refund back to the *previous* solver.
We verify at runtime it matches `request_pda.solver`.
accounts.name: prev_solver

docs: We send the slash part to the slash collector (use config.owner for simplicity).
accounts.name: slash_collector

docs: Relayer/verifier. Must be the configured owner.
accounts.name: relayer

docs: Global config
accounts.name: config

docs: Request to settle. Variant B (includes request_owner in seeds)
accounts.name: request_pda

docs: Only for seeds (Variant B)
accounts.name: request_owner

docs: Mint of the escrowed token (USDC/USDT)
accounts.name: mint

docs: Vault with the tokens (owner = PDA signer)
accounts.name: escrow_token

docs: Token account of the winning solver (same mint and owner = request_pda.solver)
accounts.name: solver_token

docs: PDA signer (same used in deposit_*)
accounts.name: sign_pda_account

docs: PDA (System) with the solver's bond
accounts.name: bond_vault

docs: Solver's wallet (to refund bond)
accounts.name: solver_wallet

docs: An account storing the current network epoch
types.name: ClockAccount

docs: An account representing a [ComputationDefinition] in a MXE.
types.name: ComputationDefinitionAccount

docs: A computation definition for execution in a MXE.
types.name: ComputationDefinitionMeta

docs: The signature of a computation defined in a [ComputationDefinition].
types.name: ComputationSignature

docs: The network epoch
types.name: Epoch

docs: A MPC Execution Environment.
types.name: MXEAccount

docs: A reference to a node in the cluster.
The offset is to derive the Node Account.
The current_total_rewards is the total rewards the node has received so far in the current
epoch.
types.name: NodeRef

docs: An output of a computation.
We currently don't support encrypted outputs yet since encrypted values are passed via
data objects.
types.name: Output

docs: A parameter of a computation.
We differentiate between plaintext and encrypted parameters and data objects.
Plaintext parameters are directly provided as their value.
Encrypted parameters are provided as an offchain reference to the data.
Data objects are provided as a reference to the data object account.
types.name: Parameter

docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.
types.name: PlanPayoutOutput
